title: >>> REDDI WIP'd
body_text:
A team attraction gone sour! Where was Tom Adams?
The legendary figure himself no-showed the 91st spectacular leaving a heavy void in the supposed DODGEBALL 90 aftermath. But a confrontation nearly five weeks in the making would not falter. The show must go on, and boy did it ever ...
Diana DiBuccio was faced with insurmountable odds heading into DODGEBALL 91. Her iconic teammate Tom Adams was no where to be found, leaving the "blind as a bat" referee at a disadvantage. But to no avail, Diana would accept the sudden change in rules and stipulations: the first-ever "2 vs. 1" contest, with the opportunity to
CREAMate
both Pierce and Londono! But with failure came the taste of two pies.
PIERCE & LONDONO vs. DIBUCCIO
The stipulation, one of laughter and comedy, was all that was funny about DODGEBALL 91. Not even a thought of smiling came across the minds of the hungry, determined, and yes, powerful warriors of Wall High School. The physicalilty was off the page.
The debut of the Grote brothers, the mammouth Kevin Megill, and of course the incredible Adams brothers insensitively erased the smiles from their seemingly defenseless victims' faces.
The match itself, one of twists, turns, and spills along the way, further proved the passion and the desire of those on the battle grounds. The inaugural round went to the loud-mouthed DiBuccio. But that was about all she would get as Pierce and Londono just ran with it following Game 2.
Justin Pierce and Juan Londono defeated Diana DiBuccio, 4 to 2, in a
CREAMation Rules
Match. *We at
dodgeball.livejournal.com
hope to receive an exclusive, first-hand look at the one and only
CREAMation
of Diana DiBuccio. Check back for the DODGEBALL 92 preview.*
Moments & Stars
: Mike "Sputz" Krott's various countdowns; Diana DiBuccio's rolling dodge; Juan Londono's priceless "La Cucaracha" pavement throw; Ryan Letsche hitting an out-of-bounds Ray Marzarella in the head.
RECORDS
> Attendance: 24
> Biggest Return: Mike Langley (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 75)
> New Players: (3) Pat Rogers, Alex Grote, Rich Grote
- DODGEBALL 91 was held on the back courts of Wall High School and for the second straight week, featured the popular
Letsche Rims
as form of team regeneration.
- This event marked the 21st
Wet War
, the seventh since DODGEBALL 80.
- DODGEBALL 91 hosted the first-ever "2 vs. 1" captains match. Tom Adams no-showed DODGEBALL 91 forcing Diana DiBuccio to compete solo.
- The match was billed as the
CREAMation 2
, where the losing team captain(s) would be hit in the face with a whipped cream filled pie. This was only the second
CREAMation Rules
match following
DODGEBALL LXXXI
in late-March 2007.
- Justin Pierce and Juan Londono emerged victorious (and clean), each improving their records to 2-1-0. This was Pierce's second consecutive captains win. As for Diana, she stands at 2-4-2.
Pierce's "Week in Dodgeball Heaven"
Named as the first DODGEBALL 100 captain; defeated Tom Adams at DODGEBALL 90; capped off with the
CREAMation
of one Diana DiBuccio. Arguably, the greatest week of any competitor, past or present!
"I can still remember just how nervous I was before my CREAMation match back in March. Yeah, it's a silly stipulation throw in, but the conclusion is all too worth it regardless of the outcome."
- JOHN TRONOLONE
"La Cucaracha!"
- JUAN LONDONO
________________________________________
____
A quadruple birthday ...
DODGEBALL 92
!
June 16, 2007
body_html:
A team attraction gone sour! Where was Tom Adams? The legendary figure himself no-showed the 91st spectacular leaving a heavy void in the supposed DODGEBALL 90 aftermath. But a confrontation nearly five weeks in the making would not falter. The show must go on, and boy did it ever ...

Diana DiBuccio was faced with insurmountable odds heading into DODGEBALL 91. Her iconic teammate Tom Adams was no where to be found, leaving the "blind as a bat" referee at a disadvantage. But to no avail, Diana would accept the sudden change in rules and stipulations: the first-ever "2 vs. 1" contest, with the opportunity to CREAMate both Pierce and Londono! But with failure came the taste of two pies.

PIERCE & LONDONO vs. DIBUCCIO
The stipulation, one of laughter and comedy, was all that was funny about DODGEBALL 91. Not even a thought of smiling came across the minds of the hungry, determined, and yes, powerful warriors of Wall High School. The physicalilty was off the page.

The debut of the Grote brothers, the mammouth Kevin Megill, and of course the incredible Adams brothers insensitively erased the smiles from their seemingly defenseless victims' faces.

The match itself, one of twists, turns, and spills along the way, further proved the passion and the desire of those on the battle grounds. The inaugural round went to the loud-mouthed DiBuccio. But that was about all she would get as Pierce and Londono just ran with it following Game 2.

Justin Pierce and Juan Londono defeated Diana DiBuccio, 4 to 2, in a CREAMation Rules Match. *We at dodgeball.livejournal.com hope to receive an exclusive, first-hand look at the one and only CREAMation of Diana DiBuccio. Check back for the DODGEBALL 92 preview.*

Moments & Stars: Mike "Sputz" Krott's various countdowns; Diana DiBuccio's rolling dodge; Juan Londono's priceless "La Cucaracha" pavement throw; Ryan Letsche hitting an out-of-bounds Ray Marzarella in the head.

RECORDS
> Attendance: 24
> Biggest Return: Mike Langley (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 75)
> New Players: (3) Pat Rogers, Alex Grote, Rich Grote

- DODGEBALL 91 was held on the back courts of Wall High School and for the second straight week, featured the popular Letsche Rims as form of team regeneration.
- This event marked the 21st Wet War, the seventh since DODGEBALL 80.
- DODGEBALL 91 hosted the first-ever "2 vs. 1" captains match. Tom Adams no-showed DODGEBALL 91 forcing Diana DiBuccio to compete solo.
- The match was billed as the CREAMation 2, where the losing team captain(s) would be hit in the face with a whipped cream filled pie. This was only the second CREAMation Rules match following DODGEBALL LXXXI in late-March 2007.
- Justin Pierce and Juan Londono emerged victorious (and clean), each improving their records to 2-1-0. This was Pierce's second consecutive captains win. As for Diana, she stands at 2-4-2.

Pierce's "Week in Dodgeball Heaven"
Named as the first DODGEBALL 100 captain; defeated Tom Adams at DODGEBALL 90; capped off with the CREAMation of one Diana DiBuccio. Arguably, the greatest week of any competitor, past or present!

"I can still remember just how nervous I was before my CREAMation match back in March. Yeah, it's a silly stipulation throw in, but the conclusion is all too worth it regardless of the outcome."
- JOHN TRONOLONE

"La Cucaracha!"
- JUAN LONDONO
____________________________________________

A quadruple birthday ... DODGEBALL 92!
June 16, 2007
